meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be otherwise; inevitably.
meanings.sent1: She had to necessarily finish her homework before going out to play.
meanings.sent2: Studying hard is necessarily important to do well on the test.
meanings.sent3: The cat necessarily knocked over the vase while chasing a fly.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was necessarily evident in the way he looked at her.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathering overhead made rain necessarily imminent.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate that a statement is logically or naturally expected.
meanings.sent1: If you eat too much, you will necessarily feel sick.
meanings.sent2: He will necessarily be late if he doesn't leave now.
meanings.sent3: The dog necessarily barked at the mailman every morning like clockwork.
meanings.sent4: Her smile necessarily brightened up the room whenever she entered.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting in the west made darkness necessarily approach.
